thread.title: Leonard Fournette's approaching milestones vs. Western Kentucky
thread.title_full: Leonard Fournette's approaching milestones vs. Western Kentucky | NOLA.com

author: Jim Kleinpeter, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Leonard Fournette's approaching milestones vs. Western Kentucky
text:
Leonard Fournette enters the game against Western Kentucky Saturday as the nation's leading rusher with 1,202 yards on 150 carries. He also leads the nation with a 204.4 yards-per-game average and is tied for the national lead in rushing touchdowns with 14.
He has broken several LSU rushing records and is moving up fast on the career rushing yardage chart.
That begs the question: What will Fournette achieve next? He's facing a Western Kentucky team that is allowing 172.7 yards per game and ranked No. 76 in the nation.
Read more: Leonard Fournette Heisman Watch after Florida.
Fournette is quietly moving up the LSU leaderboard in rushing touchdown categories. His 14 this year ties him for seventh for the single-season record with Dalton Hilliard and Charles Alexander. LaBrandon Toefield holds the record with 19.
His 24 career rushing TDs is outside the top 10 but three more will tie him for No. 8 with Kenny Hilliard, Harvey Williams and Garry James.
Scroll down for some of the approaching milestones Fournette can hit and even some that are out of reach -- for now. Here are 5 things to know about Saturday's game, which kicks off at 6:02 p.m. CT on ESPNU. Here are times of interest for a schedule of events and a position-by-position game breakdown .
And away we go:
3 yards: Will put him No. 9 in LSU career rushing yardage past Rondell Mealey.
56 yards: Will put him No. 8 in LSU career rushing yardage past LaBrandon Toefield.
81 yards: Will put him past Kevin Faulk for third-most rushing yards by an LSU player in one season. Faulk had 1,282 in 1996.
82 yards: Will put him No. 7 in LSU career rushing yardage past Charles Scott.
100 yards: Will mark the 9 th consecutive game with at least 100 yards. The LSU record is nine by Charles Alexander (1976-78). It will also put him at No. 4 with 12 in his career. Only Kevin Faulk (22), Charles Alexander (19) and Dalton Hilliard (19) have more.
200 yards: Will put him past Jeremy Hill (1,401) for second-most yards in a season. Will also be his 4 th career 200-yard game, tying him with Kevin Faulk for most in LSU history.
245 yards: Will give him a single-game career-high.
251 yards: Will establish a single-game LSU rushing record, previously set by Alley Broussard vs. Ole Miss, 2004.
282 yards: Will put him at No. 6 all-time past Terry Robiskie (2,517).
322 yards: Will break the SEC record for yards in a game held by Vanderbilt's Frank Mordica and Arkansas's Darren McFadden.
341 yards: Will put Fournette into LSU's top 5 career rushers past Joseph Addai (2001-05), who has 2,576.
451 yards: Will break the NCAA record for rushing yards in a game set by Samje Perine of Oklahoma, Nov. 22, 2014 vs. Kansas.
485 yards: Will establish a new single-season LSU record, set by Charles Alexander (1,686) in 1977.
